attributes.action: create a new public holiday, the National Remembrance Holiday to commemorate The Fallen and our Nation, with the holiday falling on the Monday in November following Rememberance Day.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
http://www.mod.uk/NR/rdonlyres/69519F89-9630-4D5F-92CF-B834FAB0FBD2/0/recognition_of_our_armed_forces.pdf

The Ministry of Defence has published a paper supporting a day of remembrance to be held on a Saturday in June called the “British Armed Forces and Veterans Day”. 

I call these days’ weekends and they do not stand out from the other days enough to do justice to the brave men and women of the forces.

I believe the Monday following Remembrance Day in November would be more appropriate as it is a time when we are already encouraged to pay our respect to the fallen and injured. Remembrance Sunday would be for remembering the dead and the Monday to celebrate the serving servants to the Crown and country.

Holding the day on a Saturday in June is an attempt by the Government to gain public support on the cheap. 

SHOW THE FORCES THEIR TRUE VALUE.
